intro: Micranthes hirta, commonly known as hairy micranthus, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its hairy leaves and stems are adaptations that help it retain moisture in dry environments. Micranthes hirta is often found in moist meadows and along stream banks.
